definition: to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon
exterior surface/family relationship via females/to show (one's opinion)/a model/a table (listing information)/a form/a meter (measuring sth)

sentences.english: The victory put Gay into his first U.S. Olympic team but the wind speed of 4.1 meters per second deprived the 25-year-old of a world record.
sentences.chinese: 這次勝出讓25歲的蓋伊首次進入美國奧運代表隊。

sentences.english: Our rowing team, we have a varsity program.
sentences.chinese: 我們的賽艇隊，我們有一個大學代表隊。

sentences.english: Every week, she led her varsity team to victory.
sentences.chinese: 每個星期，她帶領的學校籃球代表隊都能夠獲勝。

sentences.english: In 2008, Grenada sent a 15-member team to participate in the Olympic Games in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 2008年，格林納達派出15人代表隊參加奧運會。

sentences.english: Hongkong Electric Lawn Bowls team players.
Jack gave the tryouts the business but he failed to make the team.
sentences.chinese: 傑克在選拔賽中全力以赴，但他沒有被選進代表隊。

sentences.english: Jean carried off all the prizes in the competition.
sentences.chinese: 大教代表隊囊括了全部乒乓球比賽的獎項。

sentences.english: Teams come from as far away as Scotland, Hong Kong and Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 參賽隊伍有遠自蘇格蘭，香港和泰國的代表隊。

sentences.english: The college team carried off all the prizes of the table tennis.
sentences.chinese: 大教代表隊囊括了全部乒乓球比賽的獎項。

sentences.english: It's one of a lot of varsity teams we have on campus.
sentences.chinese: 這是我們校園衆多代表隊中的一個。

sentences.english: That leaves the possibility of Britain being represented by an all-English side.
sentences.chinese: 組建一支全英代表隊，這是僅有的可能。

sentences.english: The two col'lege teams will hav'e a debate' on Sat'urday.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個大學代表隊將在星期六舉行辯論。

definition: to compete/to take part in a competition
invitation tournament (e.g. between schools or firms)
preliminary contest/initial heats of a competition
to compete/to take part (in a sports event)
